events.message: On May 1st, I filed a claim regarding a collision involving my car and another vehicle at an intersection last weekend.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the details provided about the car collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to my case to guide me through the claims process and gather necessary information about the accident.
I received confirmation from the insurance company acknowledging the receipt of my claim and assuring prompt assistance.
The agent requested additional documentation including photos of the car damage, police report, and my driver's license for further processing.
I submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the accident scene and the official police report for review.
The claims team began an investigation into the details of the collision to determine liability and assess the claim's validity.
The internal investigation concluded with confirmation that the other driver was at fault for the car accident, as per the police report.
A settlement offer was proposed covering all repair costs and rental car expenses incurred due to the accident.
I provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the clarity and transparency of the settlement terms proposed by the agent.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company after final review of documents and agreement on settlement.
The agreed settlement payment was issued to cover vehicle repairs and additional damages from the auto accident.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation of payment receipt and repair completion of my car.
